description: Ground floor single storey side and rear extension. Replacement of existing windows, addition of rooflight to rear slope and windows to flank elevation, widening of steps to lower ground floor. Removal of all existing trees in the rear garden and Monkey Puzzle tree in front garden.
decision_conditions:
<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of at least one other suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development will provide a sustainable drainage system. The condition is required to be discharged prior to the commencement of development to ensure that sustainable drainage is incorporated into the design of the development.<br></p>

<p>Hard and soft landscaping scheme<br style=""><br style="">No development (other than site clearance, site preparation, demolition and the formation of foundations and trenches) shall commence on site unless a hard and soft landscaping scheme has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall include details of proposed paving, a planting specification and a programme of implementation.<br style=""><br style="">REASON: To ensure that the character and appearance of the Conservation Area are conserved in accordance with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and Section 197(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, July 2021, Paragraphs 189 to 208; The London Plan 2021 Policies HC1 Heritage conservation and growth and G5 Urban greening; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets.<br></p>

<p>Facing bricks to be approved<br></p><p>Full details of the facing brick(s) to be used for the external surfaces of the extension shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any work on the site is commenced. The development (other than site clearance, site preparation, demolition and the formation of foundations and trenches) shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the character and appearance of the Conservation Area are conserved in accordance with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and Section 197(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, July 2021, Paragraphs 189 to 208; The London Plan 2021 Policies HC1 Heritage conservation and growth and G5 Urban greening; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets<br></p>

<p>Rooflights</p><p>The rooflight hereby approved shall be of the conservation type: formed in black painted steel, fitted flush with the existing roof slope and shall not project above the plane of the roof. Prior to the commencement of construction, details of the proposed roof windows shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The required details shall include a manufacturerâ€™s specification and illustration, together with a 1:20 scale elevation drawing showing the glazing pattern and 1:5 scale vertical and horizontal cross section drawings showing the location of the rooflight in relation to the roof structure and covering, the frames, the dimensions of the glazing, the profile and dimensions of the glazing bars and spacers (if any). The development (other than site clearance, site preparation, demolition and the formation of foundations and trenches) shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to preserving the character and appearance of the Conservation Area in line with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, July 2021, Paragraphs 189 to 208; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets.<br></p>

<p>Windows</p><p>All new sash windows shall accurately replicate, in terms of material, profile and detailing, the original windows surviving to the property. They shall be painted timber, double-hung 6/6 sash windows with a slim profile and narrow integral (not applied) glazing bars with a putty finish (not timber bead). The glazing shall be no greater than 12mm (4mm glass : 4mm gas : 4mm glass) in total thickness. No trickle vents or metallic/perforated spacer bars are permitted.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to preserving the character and appearance of the Conservation Area in line with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, July 2021, Paragraphs 189 to 208; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets.</p><div><br></div>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
